title: Justin Fairfax
summary: Justin Edward Fairfax (born February 17, 1979)[2][3] is an American lawyer and politician who has served as the 41st lieutenant governor of Virginia since 2018. A member of the Democratic Party, he is the second African-American elected statewide in Virginia, following Douglas Wilder. In 2019, he faced sexual assault allegations dating to 2000 and 2004. He denied the allegations. In 2021, he was a Democratic candidate for Governor of Virginia. He finished fourth in the Democratic primary with 3.54% of the vote.[4]
